我14岁那年，家里还没有电脑的时候，就和另外两个小伙伴合作，在其中一个人的文曲星上BASIC写了第一个游戏，一个文本交互的RPG，类似于单机版的MUD。

后来有了电脑，拿vb做过打砖块，拿RPG MAKER做过龙枪的游戏。

然而仅此而已，因为一些原因，我还是没能走上游戏制作这条路。

后来我玩了很多游戏，也经常从设计的角度去想，这个游戏哪里做得好，哪里还需要改进，哪里沿用了前人的优秀设计……说不定在内心深处，玩到好作品的时候，还是会想着，自己会有机会做出来这样的作品吧。

即使是在国内游戏市场被垃圾页游充斥，以及后来的大规模低质量的轻度手游大行其道的时候，也一样。

直到我通关了《生化奇兵：无限》。

当时的感受是四个字：叹为观止。

深深的震撼自不必说，然而同时伴随而来的是强烈的失落感。

坐在电脑前一动不动，我看完了全部的片尾制作人员表。

想到做这么一款游戏所需要的高度，我怕是此生没有办法达到了。

且不说数百人的团队和上亿美元的预算，仅仅是策划这么个游戏所需要的文学素养、经验、知识储备，都让我觉得高不可及。

更遑论做这样的游戏，光专业度还不够，还需要极高的天赋。不止要有专家，还要有天才。

或许从现在开始努力还来得及，只是我当时已经选定了另一座需要用毕生之力来攀登的山峰。

人生苦短哪！不可能遍历这世上所有高峰，哪怕只是其中的一座，也不知道能不能到得了顶点。

看到有人走到了自己曾想着要达到却最后没有上路的地方，只能羡慕一下，然后继续做自己的事情吧。即使是失落，也是这个过程中不可避免的一部分。

只是那天看着制作人名单的时候，脑海里飘过了老男孩的歌词。

当初的愿望实现了吗

事到如今只好祭奠吗

任岁月风干理想

再也找不回真的我

抬头仰望这漫天星河

那时候陪伴我的那颗

这里的故事你是否还记得


还是要感谢这个创造了天空之城哥伦比亚的制作组，虽然已经不复存在，但或许还有许多人跟我一样，因为他们，才在此生此世有机会看到，自己的愿望，已经有人实现了吧。

Bioshock infinite offers a different appearance from the other games (1 and 2) yet still maintains the core gameplay of the Bioshock series to keep seasoned players engaged, but also offers simple design aspects to suit newcomers. 

Infinite's use of setting and story are crafted very well. The games atmosphere is amazing and narrative storytelling immersive. Combat is fluent and fun, especially with the rail system offering varying combat and different enemy boss types providing new challenges to the player. 

Overall a superb experience in itself. Although this is a concise and simple review, Bioshock Infinite offers an amazing and in-depth game experience on all accounts.

The 'Solid Gold Standard' of videogames, like what 'Inception' is to Hollywood or 'The Life and Times of Scrooge McDuck' to comics, or 'The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn' is to Literature. Very few games will come along that'll satisfy a true gamer like this one. I cannot recommend this highly enough. 
Note: This is a solid recommendation, not a review. There's no shortage of reviews here, but I recommend something so strongly very rarely. Trust me, buy this game, and see if you enjoy iy. If you don't, feel free to message me and let me know. I'll patiently read your message, and patiently reply with why you're wrong.

When I first started playing, I was worried that they had watered down my beloved atmosphere-rich, dystopian BioShock into a shiny, happy, save-the-princess, run-and-gun fps. But I was wrong. The game has barely begun and the cracks begin to show in the perfect seeming of Columbia. In the same way that BS2 was an adequate spiritual successor to the first and expanded upon the 'choice' motif, so is this a fair successor to each of the previous installations. In fact, Infinite is better than BS2 on almost every level and succeeds in exploring these themes in a much more satisfying, poignant way than BS2.

In the first: a man chooses, a slave obeys. What is a choice; can you choose; is choice an illusion? Do your choices even matter?
In the second: how does intention effect choice; do your intentions matter if things start to go amiss? Can you still make a different choice? Can things that have been broken be repaired? Or is anything ever truly broken?
And in Infinite: both of those sets of themes are explored throughout, culminating in the best ending in the series. 

If this game were the end of the series, this game would be a fully satisfying conclusion. A must-play for fans of the series.

Sofri uma pressão muito grande para jogar BioShock Infinite, meu amigo ficava me dizendo - [i]"Cara joga esse jogo, você vai ficar maravilhado"[/i] e foi simplesmente o que aconteceu.

O jogo é frenético, a cidade no ar mesmo parecendo uma ideia absurda (isso é comentado no próprio jogo) é fantástica, tendo até explicação de como é mantida no ar. Os personagens são sensacionais, sendo no mínimo marcantes.
 
O ponto auge do jogo é sua história, de tão complexa e envolvente, que ocorre de pessoas que finalizam o jogo e não compreendem aquilo visto com seus próprios olhos, correndo atrás de explicações e hipóteses pela internet (fui um deles).

Portanto não joguem Bioshock por jogar, ENTENDAM Bioshock Infinte, mesmo que você tenha que pegar todos os colecionáveis. Jogue o jogo novamente se puder, fará tanto sentido que você vai me agradecer. 

E por último e não menos importante JOGUEM a DLC "Bureal in the sea", ela é essencial para toda a série de Bioshock.

Para os fãs de Bioshock recomendo antes de jogar a DLC "Bureal in the sea" que leia o livro [i]Rapture[/i] escrito por John Shirley, a história conta a desde a criação de Rapture até em certo momento do Bioshock 1, situando bastante sobre Rapture em si e os personagens importantes da trama. É bem legal para quem jogou o primeiro Bioshock entender como tudo chegou até aquela situação, então recomendo.

"Tráenos a la chica y borraras tu deuda", el único objetivo que tiene que cumplir nuestro personaje que lo hará viajar hasta las nubes y lo montara en una aventura alucinante y única!! Sin duda uno de los mejores juegos de estos últimos años, con una buena trama,  una jugabilidad y controles impresionante (tanto con gamepad, como con teclado y mouse), mejorada de sus antecesores Bioshock y Bioshock 2. No hay mucho que pueda decir que no se haya dicho ya en otras reviews, así que destaco algunos de sus puntos mas fuertes.

Pro:
-Buena historia, muy buena trama, y giros inesperados.
-Buenos controles y jugabilidad.
-Gráficos y diseños impresionantes.
-Muy buena optimización y fluidez.
-Buena ambientación y sonido.
-Armas y habilidades mejorables.
-Lugares secretos.

Contra:
-Tiene uno que otro bug, como el mas conocido Salón de los Hérores, donde Elizabeth se queda colgando en el aerocarril y no se mueve.

First things first, this is an absolutely must play for anyone who loves single player narratives and/or immerisive worlds.

When I first played Bioshock Infinite, it made me take a look back at how single player narratives are intertwined into a living, breathing world. When you first see Columbia you can't help but be amazed by the beautiful city that will be the backbone the story rest upon, you instantly want to explore the city and take in all of the tiny details that turn it from a path into an actual breathing city,  until you are plunged into this more and more purplexing narrative of Elizabeth and her relationship to the villians in the game. 

Elizabeth is your A.I. companion in Infinite and the people at 2k understood the importance of getting her character right, she really pushes along the story and narrative and is someone who you truly want to help. She also aids in combat in a unique way to play without being too intrusive. 

The gameplay is smooth and is the best in the series by far. Guns are fun to use and all of them have their time and place. Vigors  on the otherhand are still fun and incredibly useful but lack variety, you typically will stick between 2-3 vigors throughout the game due to their effectiveness.

All in all this game truly has revolutionized how story telling is told through this medium and is simply a must play experience

First, I'll start off and say you don't have to play BioShock 1 and 2 to understand Infinite, as it has it's own story. It might be slightly confusing as to what's going on a few hours in, but it'll kick in. You have to pay attention foremost. Irrational Games went a different route in scenery this time. Although the creepy, dark atmosphere and enemies of Rapture is what made BioShock 1 & 2 so great, you're now in the clouds. And it looks beautiful. Add the soundtrack and it's double that. 

Gameplay is similar to what you're used to in most types of shooters. You have a array of spells called vigors and you can cast them in combination to get a desired effect. There's weapons too and while you do need to shoot your way out of situations, they're not as exciting as using vigors.

Elizabeth is extremely smart and proves to be a very helpful self-dependant ally. So no, don't worry about being a Leon from RE4.

Top voice acting, a story that is better than anything Hollywood can ever come up with and fluid gameplay. If you want to play one of the best single players, get Infinite.

BioShock will always be one of my favourite games, of all time. But infinite gets close. The story is... just too good. As with the first game in the series, the gun play and mechanics could feel tighter, but this time the gameplay and the story seem to create a slight feeling of cognitive dissonance. Not perfect, but worth playing, a hallmark in game design and story telling.
Classic, Stunning, still one of the best singleplayer game I've ever played.
